Frequently Asked Questions

Why do I need a Messenger link? Can't I just share the Facebook profile?

When someone clicks "Message" on a Facebook profile (especially on mobile), it often redirects to the App Store instead of opening your installed Messenger app. A Messenger link (m.me) opens the chat directly in your app, saving time and avoiding frustration.

What is an m.me link?

m.me is Facebook's official short link for Messenger. When you open an m.me link, it automatically launches the Messenger app (or opens Messenger on the web if you don't have the app installed) and starts a chat with that person.

Is this safe to use?

Yes, completely safe. m.me is an official Facebook domain. This tool only converts the URL format - it doesn't collect, store, or share any of your information. Everything happens in your browser.

Will this work on my phone?

Yes! Works on iPhone, Android, and any device. If you have Messenger installed, the link opens the app. If not, it opens Messenger in your web browser.

Can I use this for Facebook business pages too?

Absolutely! Works for both personal profiles and business pages. Just paste the Facebook URL and you'll get the corresponding Messenger link.

Why isn't my Messenger link working?

Try opening the link in your default browser (Safari, Chrome) instead of within another app's browser. Also, check if the Facebook account allows messages from people who aren't friends.

Can I share the generated link with others?

Yes! That's one of the main uses. Share the m.me link anywhere - Instagram bio, website, email, etc. When someone clicks it, they'll be able to message you on Messenger.
